metadata.title: CVE-2022-1973 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel in log_replay infs/ntfs3/fslog.c in the NTFS journal. This flaw allows a local attacker tocrash the system and leads to a kernel information leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1973` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

No subscription required
